subSections.title: Alternative forms
subSections.text:
* In {{w|traditional Chinese}} (Taiwan, Hong Kong, Macau) and Japanese {{w|kanji}}, the {{l|mul|乚}} stroke in {{l|mul|尤}} is further extended to the right to contain {{l|mul|彡}} in the top right corner.
* In {{w|simplified Chinese}} and Korean {{w|hanja}}, the component {{l|mul|彡}} is encased between the {{l|mul|一}} stroke and {{l|mul|乚}} stroke of {{l|mul|尤}}, which is also the historical form found in the {{w|Kangxi dictionary}}. Visually, this form is similar to {{l|mul|龙}} with two additional {{l|mul|丿}} strokes.
